clinical_study.brief_title: Clinical and Radiologic Follow up of Subchondral Fractures of the Glenoid
clinical_study.official_title: Clinical and Radiologic Follow up of Subchondral Fractures of the Glenoid

brief_summary.textblock:
in this study the investigators will call patients who had Subchondral fractures and treated in our department over the last 20 years.
The investigators will evaluate their shoulder function by a questionary, Constant score and radiologic evaluation.

detailed_description.textblock:
Patient evaluation by:
- Physical examination, questionary Constant score: Pain (severe, moderate, mild, non), activity level (sleep affected/sport limitations/daily living limitations/arm positioning) and range of motion (forward flexion/lateral elevation, internal and external rotation).
- Radiologic examination: Axial view, Axillary view and Anterior posterior view- to evaluate the level of osteoarthritis by Kellgren Lawrence score and Samilson score.

primary_outcome.description: The patients will be invited to the clinic where the investigators will examine them and define a "constant score" that takes in consideration: Pain, Activity level and Range of motion.

secondary_outcome.measure: Measurement of degenerative changes of the gleno-humeral joint.
secondary_outcome.description: The investigators will assess the status of osteoarthrosis of the gleno-humeral joint, this will be measured by the Kellgren Lawrence (0-4) and the Samilson (0-3) scores.

intervention.description: Radiologic examination: Axial view, Axillary view and Anterior posterior view- to evaluate the level of osteoarthritis by Kellgren Lawrence score and Samilson score.

study_pop.textblock: patients 18-80 yo who had subchondral fractures of the glenoid

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Any man or women who had subchondral fractures of the glenoid
Exclusion Criteria:
- Pregnant women
- Children
